page.title: 01South East Guildford
page.content:
Our area consists of S.E. Guildford, N.E. Shalford, Chilworth, Merrow Downs and Pewley Down. Part of the Pilgrims' Way passes through the area. The majority of the land is farmland and open grass land but it also includes deciduous woodland. The soil is not very suitable for arable farming and the main agricultural activity is livestock rearing. There are many streams in the South but very few on the chalk downs in the north because chalk is porous.
There is much local history in the area, especially in the village of Chilworth. On the whole there is a good community atmosphere. In the villages people are very friendly. Most people are happy living there because the amenities of Guildford are good and the countryside is near.
